e4: I recommend changing to the new policy because it aligns with ethical standards and enhances the company's credibility. Although some investors may initially misunderstand the reported earnings, the long-term benefits of transparent reporting outweigh the risks of potential legal issues and investor mistrust. This change could ultimately reinforce investor confidence and foster a stronger relationship with our stakeholders.
e5: An ethical reporting policy should prioritize transparency, accuracy, and honesty in financial disclosures. Characteristics include clear communication of earnings, unbiased reporting practices, and a commitment to legal compliance. Additionally, considering the diverse backgrounds of investors, the policy should aim to minimize confusion and ensure all stakeholders understand the financial information, protecting the interests of both retail and institutional investors.
e6: Yes, I would ask how the management plans to communicate the change in reporting policy to investors to ensure clarity and understanding. Additionally, I would like to know what measures are in place to monitor investor feedback post-implementation, and if any educational resources will be provided to assist retail investors in adapting to the new reporting standards.
